title: Apple is working on a headset that can switch between AR and VR
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**We’ve long known that Apple is developing an augmented reality (AR) headset,
with a view to launching it in 2020,** **but now it’s emerged that the unit –
codenamed T288 – will also have virtual reality (VR) capabilities built in.**

Before we dive into the details, let’s highlight the differences between AR
and VR; the former maps digital objects onto the real world (think: [Pokémon
Go](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/pokemon-go-update-2018-2993125)),
while the latter immerses users into a digital environment (think: [_Ready
Player One_](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/real-player-one-will-get-
exclusive-vr-content-via-htv-vive-2950484)).

Now you’re armed with that information, we’re ready to proceed.

_CNET_[revealed](https://www.cnet.com/news/apple-is-working-on-an-ar-
augmented-reality-vr-virtual-reality-headset-powered-by-a-wireless-wigig-hub/)
on April 27 that Apple is working on a headset, which is driven by an in-house
5nm chipset that’s more powerful than anything on the market, that will afford
users the option to switch between AR and VR with the click of a button.

The unit is said to be equipped with two high-resolution 8K screens – one in
each viewing port – and a new wireless tech that allows it to connect to a
nearby control box, which does all the technical heavy lifting, without the
need for a wire.

**Related:[Best VR Headset](https://www.trustedreviews.com/guide/best-vr-
headset)**

That’s not to mean the [T288](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-wants-
ar-headset-succeed-iphone-2020-3326019) will be completely wireless, though.
Powering a pair of 8K screens and a number of other power-hungry components
requires an awful lot of juice, so it’s safe to assume the headset will have a
tethered power cable.
